msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts
msIdentifier.idno: Misc Mss Box 24 Folder 14 Box 24 Folder 14

msContents.summary: Letter to Theophilus Garencières, an apothecary in York, from Laurence Sterne describing the condition of his wife Elizabeth following a miscarriage and requesting an opiate for her, the only known evidence of the loss of the Sternes' second child. Dated Friday morning; probably written in May 1751 (Day). Written on a quarto bifolium, with a watermark of a crowned double circle with the motto Pro Patria Eiusque Libertate. Integral address leaf marked "To Mr. Garancieres." Spindle hole in center affecting two words, partially repaired. Minimal remnants of wax seal.

msItem.title: Laurence Sterne letter to Theophilus Garencières

author.name: Geoffrey Day Collection of Laurence Sterne (University of Pennsylvania)

msItem.title: Laurence Sterne letter to Theophilus Garencières, 1751?

history.provenance: Formerly owned by Cecil Peckitt, Esq., (Goathland, Yorkshire; Curtis).
Offered for sale by Bernard Quaritch Ltd. (London), catalogue 969 (1977), number 112.
Formerly owned by Lawrence G. Blackmon (1919-2010) in 1988 (IELM).
Formerly owned by William Zachs; gift of Zachs to Geoffrey Day.
Presented by Geoffrey Day to the University of Pennsylvania Libraries, 2018.
